title: Alphabets and Sounds
content: Pupils learn the 26 letters of the alphabet (A‚ÄìZ) and the sounds they make. Practice saying the alphabet aloud and recognizing letters in words.
takehome: Practice saying and writing each letter of the alphabet daily. Try finding letters in books or on signs at home.
exercises: Write each letter from A to Z.
Circle the letters you see in a page of your storybook.
Match letters with pictures that start with the same letter.

title: Simple Words
content: Children learn to read and write simple words by combining letters and sounds.
takehome: Read aloud simple words daily. Practice writing them neatly in your notebook.
exercises: Write 5 simple words from your lesson.
Read 5 words aloud and spell them.
Draw a picture and label it with the correct word.

title: Common Nouns
content: Children identify common nouns like people, places, and things.
takehome: Find objects around your home and name them as nouns.
exercises: Write 5 nouns you see in your room.
Circle the nouns in a short story.

title: Vowel Sounds
content: Learn the short and long sounds of vowels A, E, I, O, U in words.
takehome: Practice pronouncing vowels correctly in words.
exercises: Say 5 words with long vowel sounds.

title: Consonant Sounds
content: Learn the sounds made by consonants and how they form words.
takehome: Practice pronouncing consonants clearly and forming simple words.

title: Consonant Blends
content: Children learn to blend two or more consonants to form syllables and words.
takehome: Practice reading words with consonant blends.
exercises: Circle blends in a short passage.

title: Sight Words
content: Children recognize frequently used words by sight without sounding them out.
takehome: Practice reading sight words daily for quick recognition.
exercises: Write 10 sight words in your notebook.
Find 5 sight words in a storybook.

title: Rhyming Words
content: Learn words that rhyme to improve phonemic awareness.
takehome: Practice making rhymes with everyday words.

title: Synonyms and Antonyms
content: Children learn words with similar or opposite meanings.
takehome: Find synonyms and antonyms in your reading books.
exercises: Circle synonyms and underline antonyms in a passage.

title: Basic Spelling Rules
content: Children learn simple spelling rules like adding -s for plurals, using -ed for past tense, etc.
takehome: Practice spelling words using the rules taught in class.

title: Writing Practice
content: Children practice writing letters, words, and short sentences correctly.
takehome: Practice writing simple sentences neatly every day.
exercises: Draw a picture and write a sentence about it.
